review: The consultation was for myself s I am having some health issue the doctor was very good & polite the experience has been nice I am satisfied with the consultation the doctor asked me to take some tests actually because of the lockdown I am unable to visit after the lockdown surely going to meet the doctor & would surely recommend others in future

My wife had visited the hospital and it was gynaecology related. Consultation was fine by the doctor. She is our regular doctor and knew her since long time. I would like to recommend the doctor to other people.  We went for normal checkup. There was no waiting time in the hospital when we went.

I had went to doctor for gynaecology related. ********* *** **** ** ******* I would like to recommend the doctor to other people. Vitamin tablets was prescribed by doctor during consultation. We are taking treatment. There was less waiting time in the hospital.

My wife  had been to hospital and it was for surgery related. ****** *** **** **** ** ********** ***. I can definitely recommend the doctor to my family or friends. I am satisfied with the explanation given by the doctor. Medicine was prescribed by doctor during consultation and later we went for review too. There was no waiting time in the hospital. Diet was suggested. Hospitality was good. She had surgery later.

I am sharing my experience with this hospital summarizing my experience with a very popular gynecologist Dr Nirmala Jayashankar who consults at this hospital and the way the hospital and the doctors team handled an emergency situation. the Dr consultation each time demanded half a day as her appointments were always crowded and even though you walk in with an appointment, your minimum wait time is 2 to 3 hours and you are screened by multiple doctors in her team before you can meet the Dr itself.

My wife had an issue of multiple fibroids and we were consulting the above gynecologist. The treatment and consultation was going fine for almost an year and my wife's situation reached a stage where her condition deteriorated and we met the Dr. and she was of the opinion that surgery could no longer avoided and she will fix a date after a consultation after a month and asked us to come on a specific date from her monthly cycle. in the mean time, the cycle time approached and with that my wife had some severe symptoms and we tried to approach the Dr over a call. we could not connect with her or any person from her team. After about 5 calls and lot of persuasion, we could reach out to someone in labor ward of the hospital and she advised if the situation is worse, we could come and get admitted in the emergency room.

As advised, we reached the emergency room and informed the nurse that she needs to inform the Dr and her team about our emergency. However, to our surprise the nurse in the ER was very lethargic and wanted to avoid us and after a lot of follow up, she asked us to go to labor ward itself which was on a higher floor. we did reach the labor ward on our own and tried to explain our situation to the nurse in labor ward. To our surprise, the nurse there was angry on us as to why we came there and not to the Emergency Room. we still requested here to put us in touch with anyone from Dr NJ's team or at the least inform her as she was aware of our medical condition. But to our surprise we were shown the way for ER and no one in the hospital was ready to help.
I then decided to seek a consultation from our family physician for the emergency and immediately we had to consult a new gynecologist *** *** * **** *** ******* ** ******* ********.

It was sad that Dr's become so unreachable for patients that even in times of emergency they cannot be reached absolutely. whatever the emergency may be. Is this the way we should be handled and treated ? On the part of the hospital, why was there no one attending in the ER room and the moment a patient with an emergency walks in, is it a standard procedure to let the run from one ward to another ??

I had consulted the doctor and it was for gynaecology related . ********* *** **** ** ******* I can definitely recommend the doctor to my family or friends. Scanning and blood test was done. She referred to another doctor. Waiting time was less than one hour. Doctor was friendly. Parking facility is the problem. Registration procedure is time-consuming in hospital.

I am satisfied with the explanation given by the doctor. Ultrasound was done. There was waiting time in the hospital when we went. It was for one hour. I am happy with doctor. Hospitality was good.

Her explanation regarding the problem ,her soft nature during procedures , maintaining timing, smiling attitude....
On seeing the patient and her previous history the Doctor has quickly diagnosed the cause of the problem and advised the patient with appropriate action.
